entry.value: import numpy as np%%00010# Copy input to output%%00010changed_table = input_table.copy()%%00010# creates variable to holdthe statistics name; "nan" is added to ignore any missing value present in the list of data%%00010stat = "nan"+flow_variables['statistics']%%00010%%00010def string_to_list(string):%%00010%%00009#print(string)%%00010%%00009# splitting string from table using delimiter%%00010%%00009list_string = str(string).split(flow_variables['delimiter'])%%00010%%00009list_numeric = []%%00010%%00009#converting string in list to number%%00010%%00009for item in list_string:%%00010%%00009%%00009#print(item)%%00010%%00009%%00009try:%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009list_numeric.append(float(item))%%00010%%00009%%00009except:%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009#print(item)%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009pass%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00010%%00009# compute the statistics in case there is at least 1 item in the list%%00010%%00009if len(list_numeric) > 0:%%00010%%00009%%00009result = getattr(np, stat)(list_numeric)%%00010%%00009else:%%00010%%00009%%00009result = None%%00010 %%00010%%00009return result%%00010%%00010# applying function string_to_list for all cells in the table%%00010output_table = changed_table.applymap(lambda x: string_to_list(x))%%00010
